G4243-d-11-22-97-WC.Narrative: AT 5:12 A. M. ON NOVEMBER 22 1997, WC TRAIN T050 CONSISTING OF 70 CARS (  32 LOADS & 38 EMPTIES ) WAS TRAVELING RAILROAD EASTBOUND ( GEORGRAPHIC SOUTHBOUND ) ON THE CHICAGO SUB, EASTERN DIVISION WHEN11 CARS DERAILED AT MILEPOST 142.2 IN LOMIRA,WI.  THE TRAIN WAS OPERATING UNDER CTC AT THE TIME. ONEOF THE DERAILED CARS, A TANK CONTAINING KAOLIN, A NON- HAZARDOUS CLAY SLURRY MATERIAL, IMPACTED INTO AN INDUSTRIAL BUILING LOCATED ALONG THE TRACK LINE.THE TANK CAR RUPTURED AND RELEASED ALMOST ALL OF ITS NON HAZARDOUS CONTENTS.  AN INDUSTRY EMPLOYEE WORKING IN THE BUILDING FATALLY INJURIED. FOUR OTHER EMPLOYEES SUSTAINED MINOR INJURIES AND WERE TREATED / RELEASED BY A LOCAL HOSPITAL  FRA TOXICITY TESTING WAS ADMINISTERED TO THE CREW . ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE . THE LOCOMOTIVE EVENTS RECORED DATA WAS DOWNLOADED AND NO EXCEPTIONS TAKEN OF THE CREW INVESTIGATION INTO THIS INCIDENT REVEALED THECAUSE TO BE A DETAILED FRACTURE IN THE RAIL.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
